metadata.chain_name: Missing Persons Decision Chain - Federal Baseline
metadata.description: Federal baseline for missing children case handling. Maps the decision chain from initial report through investigation, action, and feedback loops. Identifies failure points and parent advocacy leverage.
legal_framework: Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act (2006)

ACK-01.name: Initial Report Receipt
ACK-01.description: First point of contact when a child is reported missing. Law enforcement must accept the report immediately without waiting period.
ACK-01.federal_requirement: National Child Search Assistance Act requires immediate entry into NCIC - no waiting period for children under 21
failure_indicators: Waiting period imposed before accepting report
parent_leverage: Federal law prohibits waiting periods - cite National Child Search Assistance Act
Escalate to supervisor if report refused
Contact state attorney general if stonewalled

ACK-02.name: NCIC Entry
ACK-02.description: Entry of missing child into National Crime Information Center database within 2 hours of report.
ACK-02.federal_requirement: National Child Search Assistance Act mandates NCIC entry within 2 hours for children under 18
required_actions: Enter child into NCIC Missing Person File
failure_indicators: Child not flagged as endangered when criteria met
No cross-reference with foster care/CPS systems
parent_leverage: Ask for written confirmation of entry time
Request supervisor review of entry completeness

ACK-03.name: NCMEC Notification
ACK-03.description: Notification to National Center for Missing & Exploited Children for case coordination and resources.
ACK-03.federal_requirement: NCMEC must be notified for all missing children cases to enable poster distribution, tip line, and coordination
required_actions: Request AMBER Alert evaluation if applicable
parent_leverage: Parents can contact NCMEC directly at 1-800-THE-LOST

ACK-04.name: Investigator Assignment
ACK-04.description: Assignment of dedicated investigator to the missing child case.
ACK-04.federal_requirement: No federal mandate, but best practices require assignment within 24-48 hours
failure_indicators: Case sits in queue without action
parent_leverage: Request investigator name and direct contact
Escalate to police chief if no assignment

ACK-05.name: CPS/Foster Care Cross-Reference
ACK-05.description: For children in state custody or with CPS history, cross-reference with child welfare systems.
ACK-05.federal_requirement: Fostering Connections Act requires states to report foster children missing within 24 hours
ACK-05.timeline: Within 24 hours if child has CPS/foster history
required_actions: Check if child is in foster care system
failure_indicators: Foster child not flagged in missing person system
CPS not notified of missing foster child
parent_leverage: File complaint if foster child not properly reported

ACK-06.name: NamUs Entry
ACK-06.description: Entry into National Missing and Unidentified Persons System for long-term case tracking.
ACK-06.federal_requirement: Recommended for cases unresolved after 30 days; some states mandate earlier entry
ACK-06.timeline: Within 30 days if unresolved, or immediately for high-risk cases
failure_indicators: No DNA reference collected from family
Case goes cold without NamUs entry
parent_leverage: Families can create NamUs cases directly
Push for NamUs entry before 30 days

DUE-01.name: Risk Assessment
DUE-01.description: Evaluation of risk level to determine investigation priority and resources.
DUE-01.federal_requirement: AMBER Alert criteria evaluation required; endangered runaway vs family abduction vs stranger abduction classification
required_actions: Classify case type (runaway, family abduction, non-family abduction)

classification_criteria.endangered: Child under 13, has disability, in life-threatening situation, or with dangerous person
classification_criteria.family_abduction: Taken by family member in custody dispute

failure_indicators: Endangered child classified as routine runaway
Resources not matched to risk level
parent_leverage: Insist on endangered classification if criteria met
Request AMBER Alert consideration in writing
Escalate if risk assessment seems inadequate

DUE-02.name: Jurisdiction Determination
DUE-02.description: Determination of which agency has primary jurisdiction and when federal involvement is warranted.
DUE-02.federal_requirement: FBI has jurisdiction when child crosses state lines (Federal Kidnapping Act) or after 24 hours presumption
DUE-02.timeline: Within 24 hours; earlier if evidence of interstate flight
required_actions: Notify FBI if federal criteria met
federal_involvement_triggers: 24-hour presumption rule (child presumed taken across state lines)
failure_indicators: FBI not notified when criteria met
parent_leverage: Request FBI involvement if interstate suspected
Contact FBI field office directly if local agency unresponsive

DUE-03.name: Investigation Priority Assignment
DUE-03.description: Assignment of investigation priority level based on risk assessment and case factors.
DUE-03.federal_requirement: No federal mandate, but endangered missing children should receive highest priority

priority_levels.critical: Non-family abduction, endangered child, trafficking suspected - 24/7 resources
priority_levels.high: Family abduction with danger indicators, young child runaway - dedicated team
priority_levels.medium: Older teen runaway, custody dispute - assigned investigator

parent_leverage: Provide new evidence to elevate priority
Contact command if priority seems wrong

DUE-04.name: AMBER Alert Decision
DUE-04.description: Decision on whether to issue AMBER Alert based on DOJ criteria.
DUE-04.federal_requirement: DOJ AMBER Alert criteria: confirmed abduction, child under 18, serious danger, sufficient description
amber_criteria: Child is in imminent danger of serious bodily injury or death
Sufficient descriptive information to issue alert
Child's name and other data entered in NCIC
failure_indicators: Qualifying case not submitted for AMBER
parent_leverage: Media outreach if AMBER denied but warranted

DUE-05.name: Trafficking Assessment
DUE-05.description: Evaluation of human trafficking indicators, especially for runaways and foster children.
DUE-05.federal_requirement: Trafficking Victims Protection Act requires assessment; JVTA screening for foster youth
DUE-05.timeline: Within 48 hours, or immediately if indicators present
trafficking_indicators: Signs of physical abuse or branding
Missing from foster care or group home
parent_leverage: Request FBI involvement if trafficking suspected

DUE-06.name: Family Abduction/Custody Evaluation
DUE-06.description: For custody-related cases, determination of legal standing and international abduction risk.
DUE-06.federal_requirement: Hague Convention on International Child Abduction; International Parental Kidnapping Crime Act
DUE-06.timeline: Within 24 hours if custody dispute involved
failure_indicators: Treated as civil matter without criminal investigation
parent_leverage: Request passport alert if international risk
Contact Office of Children's Issues (State Dept)
Push for criminal charges if warranted

ACT-01.name: Active Investigation
ACT-01.description: Ongoing investigative activities to locate the missing child.
ACT-01.federal_requirement: Investigation must continue until child is located or case resolved
parent_leverage: Request meeting with investigator and supervisor

ACT-02.name: Multi-Agency Coordination
ACT-02.description: Coordination between local, state, and federal agencies for complex cases.
ACT-02.federal_requirement: FBI involvement after 24 hours or evidence of interstate flight
required_actions: Establish joint operations center if warranted
parent_leverage: Use Congressional representative for federal coordination

ACT-03.name: Public Alert Issuance
ACT-03.description: Issuance of public alerts including AMBER Alert, social media, and media coordination.
ACT-03.federal_requirement: AMBER Alert if criteria met; no waiting period for public notification
ACT-03.timeline: Within hours of determination that public help needed
required_actions: Coordinate with NCMEC for poster distribution
parent_leverage: Create and share social media posts

ACT-04.name: Search Operations
ACT-04.description: Organized search efforts including ground searches, K-9 units, and aerial support.
ACT-04.federal_requirement: No federal mandate, but resources should match case priority
required_actions: Deploy search teams to relevant areas
failure_indicators: Search limited in scope without justification
parent_leverage: Engage private search organizations if needed

ACT-05.name: Recovery and Reunification
ACT-05.description: When child is located, safe recovery and return to appropriate guardian.
ACT-05.federal_requirement: Child must be returned to legal guardian; welfare assessment required
parent_leverage: Demand safety assessment of home before return

ACT-06.name: Prosecution Support
ACT-06.description: Building criminal case when abduction or trafficking confirmed.
ACT-06.federal_requirement: Federal prosecution available for interstate kidnapping, international abduction, trafficking
failure_indicators: Family abduction treated as civil only
parent_leverage: Push for federal charges if applicable

FBK-01.name: Case Status Review
FBK-01.description: Regular review of case status to ensure continued progress and resource allocation.
FBK-01.federal_requirement: No federal mandate, but best practices require weekly reviews for active cases
FBK-01.timeline: Weekly for active cases, monthly for cold cases
required_actions: Review all leads and actions taken

FBK-02.name: Cold Case Review
FBK-02.description: Formal review process when case becomes inactive to determine next steps.
FBK-02.federal_requirement: Case cannot be closed while child remains missing; periodic review required
FBK-02.timeline: After 90 days of no active leads, then annually
required_actions: Review all evidence with fresh eyes
failure_indicators: Family not contacted for cold case review
parent_leverage: Contact NCMEC for case review assistance

FBK-03.name: Agency Accountability Review
FBK-03.description: Review of agency performance when failures identified in case handling.
FBK-03.federal_requirement: No federal mandate, but states should have oversight mechanisms
FBK-03.timeline: After case resolution or upon complaint

FBK-04.name: Case Closure/Resolution
FBK-04.description: Proper closure of case when child is recovered or outcome determined.
FBK-04.federal_requirement: NCIC and NCMEC entries must be updated; case cannot close while child missing

FAIL-01.name: Report Refusal/Delay
FAIL-01.description: Law enforcement refuses to take missing child report or imposes waiting period.
FAIL-01.legal_violation: National Child Search Assistance Act - no waiting period for children under 21
FAIL-01.impact: Critical delay in investigation initiation; lost golden hours
FAIL-01.frequency: Decreasing but still occurs, especially for runaways and foster children
parent_advocacy: Cite federal law prohibiting waiting periods
Document date, time, officer who refused
FAIL-01.systemic_fix: Mandatory training on federal requirements; disciplinary action for violations

FAIL-02.name: NCIC Entry Failure
FAIL-02.description: Child not entered into NCIC within required 2-hour window.
FAIL-02.legal_violation: National Child Search Assistance Act - 2-hour NCIC entry requirement
FAIL-02.impact: Child not visible to other agencies; recovery delayed
FAIL-02.systemic_fix: Automated NCIC entry systems; auditing of entry times

FAIL-03.name: No Investigator Assignment
FAIL-03.description: Case sits without assigned investigator; no active investigation occurring.
FAIL-03.legal_violation: No specific federal law, but violates duty to investigate
FAIL-03.impact: Case stagnates; leads go cold; family left in limbo
parent_advocacy: Engage media if pattern of neglect

FAIL-04.name: Foster Care System Disconnect
FAIL-04.description: Missing foster child not properly reported or cross-referenced with CPS systems.
FAIL-04.legal_violation: Fostering Connections Act - 24-hour reporting requirement for missing foster children
FAIL-04.impact: Foster children especially vulnerable; trafficking risk increases
FAIL-04.frequency: Disturbingly common; foster children overrepresented in missing cases
FAIL-04.systemic_fix: Automated link between foster care and missing persons databases; mandatory trafficking screening

FAIL-05.name: Inadequate Risk Assessment
FAIL-05.description: Child's risk level underestimated; endangered child treated as routine runaway.
FAIL-05.legal_violation: Failure to apply AMBER Alert criteria; negligent investigation
FAIL-05.impact: Resources not allocated; child remains in danger longer
FAIL-05.frequency: Common for teens and repeat runaways
FAIL-05.systemic_fix: Mandatory risk assessment protocols; training on trafficking indicators

FAIL-06.name: Jurisdictional Failure
FAIL-06.description: Agencies dispute jurisdiction; investigation falls through cracks.
FAIL-06.legal_violation: Failure to coordinate as required by law
FAIL-06.systemic_fix: Clear jurisdictional protocols; mandatory FBI notification triggers

FAIL-07.name: AMBER Alert Denial
FAIL-07.description: Qualifying case denied AMBER Alert without justification.
FAIL-07.legal_violation: Failure to apply DOJ AMBER Alert criteria fairly
FAIL-07.impact: Public not engaged; critical time lost
FAIL-07.frequency: Occurs when criteria misunderstood or gatekeeping
parent_advocacy: Request denial in writing with reasons
Engage media to create public pressure

FAIL-08.name: Trafficking Screening Failure
FAIL-08.description: Trafficking indicators missed; victim returned to dangerous situation.
FAIL-08.frequency: Common for runaways; disproportionately affects foster youth
FAIL-08.systemic_fix: Mandatory trafficking screening protocols; specialized training

FAIL-09.name: Investigation Goes Cold
FAIL-09.description: Investigation becomes inactive without resolution; leads not followed.
FAIL-09.legal_violation: Case cannot be closed while child missing
FAIL-09.impact: Family abandoned; recovery less likely over time
FAIL-09.frequency: Common after initial 72 hours if no leads
FAIL-09.systemic_fix: Mandatory case reviews; cold case unit resources

FAIL-10.name: Inadequate Search Efforts
FAIL-10.description: Search scope insufficient; areas not covered; resources not deployed.
FAIL-10.legal_violation: Failure to allocate resources matching case priority
FAIL-10.impact: Child may be in searchable area but not found
FAIL-10.frequency: Budget-driven; more common in rural areas
FAIL-10.systemic_fix: Minimum search standards; mutual aid agreements

ADV-01.name: Immediate Parent Actions
ADV-01.description: Critical actions parents should take in first 24-48 hours.
action_checklist: Provide recent photo and physical description
List all known associates and locations
Preserve child's room and belongings as evidence
common_mistakes: Not following up on NCIC entry

ADV-02.name: Escalation Strategies
ADV-02.description: How to escalate when agencies are unresponsive or making errors.
documentation_needed: Timeline of all contacts with agencies
Names and badge numbers of personnel

ADV-03.name: Legal Actions Available
ADV-03.description: Legal remedies available to families when system fails.
ADV-03.timing: After exhausting agency remedies or in parallel
legal_options: File complaint with state attorney general
Request investigation by child welfare ombudsman
Civil rights complaint (Section 1983) if constitutional violations
Mandamus action to compel agency action
when_to_involve_attorney: Pattern of failures affecting multiple families

ADV-04.name: Community and Media Engagement
ADV-04.description: Strategies for engaging community and media to aid search.
community_actions: Engage local businesses to post flyers
cautions: Be wary of false tips and scams

ADV-05.name: Long-Term Advocacy
ADV-05.description: Advocacy for systemic change based on case experience.
organizations_to_engage: National Center for Victims of Crime

ADV-06.name: State-Specific Resources
ADV-06.description: State-level resources and contacts for missing children cases.
ADV-06.note: This node is populated with state-specific data based on user's state

common_resources.state_clearinghouse: Each state has a missing children clearinghouse
common_resources.state_coordinator: Many states have a Missing Child Coordinator
common_resources.state_police_unit: State police often have specialized units
common_resources.attorney_general: AG office can intervene in problem cases

ADV-06.lookup_method: Query with state abbreviation for specific contacts

key_timelines.amber_alert_decision: Within 4 hours if criteria potentially met
key_timelines.fbi_involvement: Within 24 hours or upon interstate evidence
key_timelines.case_review: Weekly for active, monthly for inactive

key_provisions: No waiting period for missing child reports under 21
No removal from NCIC until child located
AMBER Alert coordinators in each state
Extended missing person reporting age to 21
Immediate NCIC entry for 18-21 year olds
